intro: Syngramma hosei, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its vibrant floral display.
